gep.model

Class GeneArchitecture<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gep.model.GeneArchitecture<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The return type of a node in the encoded expression tree.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GeneArchitecture<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is a factory class to create random genes and works as a identifier for genes to test if they were produced by the same architecture and therefore can be genetically merged. An instance of this class includes meta information shared by all genes created by this factory.
    Author:
    Johannes Wortmann
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        potentialFunctions - The set of potential functions for generated genes.
        potentialTerminals - The set of potential terminals for generated genes.

      • GeneArchitecture

        public GeneArchitecture(int headlength,
                        java.util.ArrayList<GeneFunction<T>> potentialFunctions,
                        java.util.ArrayList<? extends GeneTerminal<T>> potentialTerminals,
                        boolean isModifiable)
        Creates a new factory for genes with respect to the given factory parameters.
        Parameters:
        headlength - The length of the head of generated genes.
        potentialFunctions - The set of potential functions for generated genes.
        potentialTerminals - The set of potential terminals for generated genes.
        isModifiable - True if the generated genes should be modifiable by genetic operators, false otherwise.

    • Method Detail

      • getGeneLength

        public int getGeneLength()
        Returns the length of genes that are using this architecture. The length is the sum of the head and the tail of genes and includes non-coding regions of the gene.
        Returns:
        The length of the corresponding gene

      • createRandomGene

        public Gene<T> createRandomGene()
        Creates a random instance of a gene using this architecture. This function uses the default random engine.
        Returns:
        A random instance of a gene using this architecture.

      • createRandomGene

        public Gene<T> createRandomGene(RandomEngine r)
        Creates a random instance of a gene using this architecture
        Parameters:
        r - The random engine that should be used.
        Returns:
        A random instance of a gene using this architecture.

      • createRandomGenes

        public java.util.List<Gene<T>> createRandomGenes(int numberOfInstances)
        Convenient function to create multiple random instances of genes using this architecture. This function uses the default random engine.
        Parameters:
        numberOfInstances - The number of random genes that should be created.
        Returns:
        A list of randomly created genes that use this architecture

      • createRandomGenes

        public java.util.List<Gene<T>> createRandomGenes(RandomEngine r,
                                                 int numberOfInstances)
        Convenient function to create multiple random instances of genes using this architecture. This function uses the default random engine.
        Parameters:
        r - The random engine that should be used.
        numberOfInstances - The number of random genes that should be created.
        Returns:
        A list of randomly created genes that use this architecture

      • createGeneFromSequence

        public static <T> Gene<T> createGeneFromSequence(java.util.List<GeneElement<T>> sequence)
        Creates a new modifiable gene from the given sequence. If the sequence does not contain enough elements in the tail to be a valid gene this function will pad the gene with random terminals from the set of terminals contained in the sequence.

        The corresponding GeneArchitecture can be accessed by accessing the gene architecture member of the returned gene. This architecture can then be used to create genes using the same architecture but with random sequence.

        Parameters:
        sequence - The sequence of the created gene.
        Returns:
        A new instance of a modifiable gene using the given sequence.

      • createGeneFromSequence

        public static <T> Gene<T> createGeneFromSequence(java.util.List<GeneElement<T>> sequence,
                                                 boolean isModifiable)
        Creates a new gene from the given sequence. If the sequence does not contain enough elements in the tail to be a valid gene this function will pad the gene with random terminals from the set of terminals contained in the sequence.

        The corresponding GeneArchitecture can be accessed by accessing the gene architecture member of the returned gene. This architecture can then be used to create genes using the same architecture but with a random sequence.

        Parameters:
        sequence - The sequence of the created gene
        isModifiable - True if the gene should be modifiable by genetic operators, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        A new instance of a modifiable gene using the given sequence.

      • createGenesFromSequence

        public static <T> java.util.List<Gene<T>> createGenesFromSequence(java.util.List<GeneElement<T>> sequence,
                                                                  boolean isModifiable,
                                                                  int numInstances)
        Creates multiple genes from the given sequence. If the sequence does not contain enough elements in the tail to be a valid gene this function will pad the gene with random terminals from the set of terminals contained in the sequence.

        The corresponding GeneArchitecture can be accessed by accessing the gene architecture member of one of the returned genes. This architecture can then be used to create genes using the same architecture but with a random sequence.

        Parameters:
        sequence - The sequence of the created gene
        isModifiable - True if the gene should be modifiable by genetic operators, false otherwise.
        numInstances - the number of genes that should be created from the given sequence.
        Returns:
        A new instance of a modifiable gene using the given sequence.
